page.title: 14Lockinge Estate,Ardington 2.
page.content: At the time when many large estates were being broken up and increasing mechanisation meant fewer jobs, the present owner,Mr Christopher Loyd,asked the parish councils of Ardington and Lockinge to define the sort of villages they wanted. They decided that the villages should retain existing amenities and attempt to bring in new people who had something in common with the existing population. The Estate responded by creating workshop premises from redundant farm buildings.30 new businesses employing 100 people are now established. Some houses have been sold to employees and the money spent on modernising the rest.The Estate runs a timber yard and employs 18 people to make doors and window frames etc. and maintain the buildings.
